Question: MCQ Q1 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 1): Which of the following best defines a set?
MCQ Q2 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 2): Which statement best describes a subset?
Option1: Every element of one set is contained in another
Option3: A set containing elements not in the other

Question: MCQ Q3 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 3): What is the union of sets A = {1,2} and B = {2,3}?
MCQ Q4 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 4): What is the intersection of sets A = {a,b,c} and B = {b,c,d}?
MCQ Q5 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 5): Which of the following correctly describes the complement of a set A in a universal set U?
Option1: All elements in U that are not in A
Option2: All elements in A that are not in U
Option3: The intersection of A and U
Option4: The union of A and U

Question: MCQ Q6 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 6): If U = {1,2,3,4,5} and A = {2,4}, what is the complement of A in U?
MCQ Q7 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 7): Which option best synthesizes the concept of a power set?
Option1: The set of all possible subsets of a given set
Option2: The set containing the union of two sets
Option3: The set of all elements not in the original set
Option4: The Cartesian product of a set with itself

Question: MCQ Q8 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 8): Consider set A = {x | x is an even number less than 10}. Which option best describes its power set?
Option2: The set of all subsets of {2,4,6,8}
Option3: The set of even numbers less than 10

Question: MCQ Q9 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 9): Two sets A and B are said to be equinumerous if:
Option1: There exists a bijection between A and B
Option2: They have the same number of elements

Question: MCQ Q10 on Sets and Relations (Difficulty 10): Which statement best evaluates the relationship between a set and its power set in terms of cardinality?
Option1: The power set of any set has a strictly greater cardinality than the set itself
Option2: The power set of any set is equal in cardinality to the set
Option3: The power set of any set has a lower cardinality than the set
Option4: Cardinality cannot be determined for a power set
